alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 12:21AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Dallas. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Mesquite, Richardson, Rowlett, Wylie, Balch Springs, University Park, Sachse, Seagoville, Highland Park, Sunnyvale and Buckingham.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
